The program use higher fitness value to mark better individuals, but I 
am =
working on a problem which requires minimum optimization while using 
error=
s as fitness values. 
The XOR-Experiment employs a method of subtracting th=
e error from a 
high constant to turn lower value to be higher value, but w=
hen the 
input data and output data  vary in a wide range,  how can I decid=
e the 
constant? Do I have to use a very high constant? Since the lowest er=
ror 
is supposed to be zero, so if I divided by the error, the result is 
c=
lose to infinite, then how can I decide the terminate conditon?
Let me elab=
orate on my case. The input pattern is a two-column array 
while the output=
 pattern three-column, the data vary in a wide range 
and randomly, either =
